data.title: Outstanding !!
data.text: You'll have a very tough time finding better Italian food in the entire area than Rosetti's presents every single time. You owe it to yourself to plan a visit and you won't regret it.

data.title: Lovely meal
data.text: Luckily, I was able to get a reservation here before seeing a show at the Lynn Auditorium.  I read the reviews on TA, as usual, to find a place to eat.  This is listed as #3 and since #1 & #2 were full, I tried  Rossetti's.  It was wonderful.  My friend and I were warmly greeted, and were seated immediately.  The food is visually appealing  and tasted great.  A nice balance of flavorings in everything we ate.  We split the "zucchini Blossoms" app; hard to describe, but delicious .  Both of us got the Swordfish special; perfectly cooked fish in a light tomato/ wine base(?) not sure but it was delicious; served on spaghetti .  We shared the "mini Cannolis"  for dessert.   The meal was $70pp with wine, app, entrees, dessert, cappuccino, tax & tip. I would definitely go back here again.

data.title: Outstanding in all respects
data.text:
This restaurant is tucked away in downtown Lynn, MA.  Do not let the location deter you.
From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed.  As a female solo diner, I don't always receive the level of service that twosomes and groups receive.  Some restaurant staff behave in an awkward manner, which in turn makes me uncomfortable.  Not here!  The hostesses were more than happy to seat me, but I opted to wait for a seat the bar.  Meanwhile, they took a drink order which was promptly delivered while I waited.  The hostesses themselves, circled the bar a few times to keep me updated on the seating situation.  When I was seated at the bar, the bartender immediately introduced himself, something which always impresses me.  It was late on a Sunday night, close to their closing time, but the bartender answered all of my questions about the menu and told me not to worry about what time it was, to order what I wanted.  They were also willing to prepare something that wasn't on the menu, and that is appreciated.  Because of the hour, I chose to have an appetizer and a cocktail.  The Apple Alexander was a dreamy, silken concoction that was reminiscent of drinks I've had at grand old hotels.  The meatball appetizer I chose was meaty and not a breadball like in some places.  The red sauce was sufficiently spicy/sweet, and for me, it was just right.  The bar patrons were friendly as well, and it was nice to be able to engage in casual conversation.  I love the atmosphere; it was warm and inviting.  
I can't say enough about the food, the staff and the ambiance.  Glad I live nearby so can come here often!

data.title: Wonderful food, fabulous service
data.text:
I had dinner there one evening with a small group of friends, the waitress was wonderful, answered all questions about how the food was prepared and made excellent suggestions about wine pairings. 
A great dining experience.

data.title: Top Notch Gem in a Ghetto Location
data.text:
Food is fine dining.
Food and drinks are consistently on point.
Owner is a nice, friendly man who visits each table personally.
Great for special occasions or every day as there's a range of items and prices to suit every budget.
Not stuck up or stuffy atmosphere.
Keep up your great job Rossetti's :)

data.title: Tucked Away Gem
data.text: Decided to try the 'new' restaurant I have been passing frequently, FABULOUS!  The bar staff was attentive with wonderfully handcrafted selections.  The service was spot on. The meal was fantastic, Glad we made a reservation as the place filled up quickly. Upscale interior although I would suggest a slightly higher light level to more easily read the menu. This may become my new local place ;)

data.title: Sunday Dinner and hand-crafted cocktails!
data.text: The food is unbelievable and very delicious! When you enter the restaurant, you feel like you are in a high-end place in downtown Boston. It is beautiful and very modern. I love going there on Sunday's and having the traditional Sunday dinner, with all of the meats and homemade pasta. Their cocktails have handcrafted ice cubes, that believe it or not actually taste different then regular cubes! Great Place!!!

data.title: A downtown gem in Lynn!
data.text: Rossetti's is a great upscale restaurant in the city!  The atmosphere is romantic with a modern urban vibe.  The staff is friendly and attentive!  And the food of course is great!  Portions are large and nicely presented!  Rossetti's has a  great wine selection as well!

data.title: Best Italian Food
data.text: This is a great family owned restaurant with great food and drinks. The bar is great . This place usually pretty busy, make a reservation.  Order the thin crust pizza for an  app !

data.title: Great, very authentic Italian.
data.text: Always reliably delicious Italian restaurant.  Don't miss the shrimp scampi or the amazing cocktails.  The food is great throughout the menu.

data.title: lived up to expectations and more!
data.text:
as regular diners at rosetti's cafe in winthrop, ma, we decided to try this second rosetti's offering a restaurant alternative to the smaller cafe.  upon entering the restaurant we were dazzled by the very upscale, attractive decor.  the attractive bar and casual seating in the room where one enters was very appealing as we made ur way through into the smaller, quieter dining room.

the menu was fuller and more inspired than the simple cafe offerings.  clearly much thought has gone into all aspects of this restaurant.  our server was well informed, enthusiastic and very attentive.  his recommendations were helpful and proved very reliable.  two of us split a generous and delicious single caesar salad, which the kitchen split for us before it was served.  the lettuce was fresh and the parmesan high quality.

the various entrees ordered by our party of four proved equally wonderful.  as at the cafe, the eggplant parmesan featured extremely light eggplant completely lacking in heavy breadcrumbs and oily texture, dressed in their signature rich tomato sauce.  others in our party ordered ricotta gnocchi and tagliatelle bolognese.  all beautifully and thoughtfully prepared with subtle seasonings.

desserts, including cannoli and tira misu, were equally wonderful.

we will definitely return again ... and again!!!  

our only criticism is the fact that the room is loud - almost too loud for any kind of intimate conversation.  but the food makes up for it.

data.title: Super service
data.text: We were in Lynn for a concert and looking for a place for a quick bite. Unbeknownst to us, power was out in much of the city, including Rossetti's. We were told we could order cocktails and cold appetizers. The place was packed, despite no A/C, lights and a limited menu. My friend and I sat at the bar and ordered drinks, salads and antipasti. The manager (Chris) was constantly floating around the restaurant apologizing for the inconvenience. All the servers and kitchen staff were doing their best under difficult circumstances. They all went WAY out of their way to be positive and helpful. I can't say enough about what a great attitude they had. Oh, and the food was excellent too!!!

data.title: Bucket List Burger
data.text: Rossetti Restaurant, my top 5 bucket list best burger in the North Shore. No doubt this is upscale dining, if your napkin falls it will not hit the floor! However service had very little to do with this burger being one of the very best I have ever had. More often than not when chefs start blending different cuts of meat it ends up trying too hard and you just keep wondering what is wrong...not here, I can only imagine the late nights adding this removing that...they got it perfect. The most savory burger I have every bitten in to. Then they add the most sweetest balsamic caramelized onions and the added pop of house cut bacon makes for such a savory sweet combination. Combine that with a creamy cheddar and a lightly toasted fantastic Brioche bun and BOOM!! I have been there a half a dozen times, and spot on medium rare every time. I must add once I picked up the burger, I never put it down. Consumed in a circular motion, with two hands and constantly looking left and right as to make sure no one wood steel it. Not my proudest moment but that's what this burger will do to you. The burger is going to set you back $16.95, witch is reflecting the more expensive cuts of beef. To be honest , it is so good you wont care about the price, your focus will be when your coming back!

data.title: A Little Pricey, But Very Good
data.text: We recently had a great dining experience at Rossetti Restaurant. Reservations had been recommended to us, so we made them about a week in advance. We were glad we did as the place was packed by 6:30 PM.  We were seated in a back room which was fine (although I usually prefer to sit by the window … just forgot to ask when making the reservation).  Three of us started with a glass of merlot ($10/each) and a soda water ($3).  For an appetizer, we shared an order of the Zucchini Blossoms ($14.95 for 4).  It was really good!  For entrées, two of us ordered one of the specials of the night: the Petite Filet and Lobster Tail ($39.95).  The filet was very tender, but the lobster tails (2 each) were perhaps a little overcooked (?) as it was hard to get the lobster meat out.  It was served on a bed of linguine, and I had to laugh when our server said it came with broccoli … There was one little strand of broccoli rabe on our plates.  One of the other people in our party ordered the Swordfish special ($29.95), which he loved.  It was served on a bone, which I had never seen before.  It came with a side of potatoes (included) as well as a side of Roasted Asparagus ($7.95!).  My husband ordered his usual Veal Parmagiani ($19.95), which he loved.  The food and the atmosphere (the owner and his son both came over to see how we were doing) were awesome.  I guess we were just taken aback that the meal (one appetizer, 4 entrées, and 3 glasses of wine) came to just under $200.  I think Rossetti Restaurant will be filed under “Special Occasions Only” for us.

data.title: Always a great visit!
data.text: Food is always excellent as is the staff!  Reservations advised.  Especially nights of concerts at the Auditorium.. Ceilings in the restaurant are high and noise can be a problem.

data.title: Outstanding Food
data.text: We were a party of 6 on a Saturday night and it was the first visit for all of us. It was a great experience - everyone's meals were delicious, the drinks were very good, our waitress was attentive and professional and last but not least great desserts. We will definitely come back. I actually liked this restaurant better than the Blue OX which is also located in Lynn, MA.

data.title: Good but overpriced.
data.text: It was good but overpriced. A but pretentious without the level of food or service I'd expect to back it up. The veal was very good. Tri's lobster ravioli was pretty much tasteless. They did wrap the wine up and seal it in a bag so you could take it home. Cool.

data.title: A Culinary Delight
data.text: The North Shore has some wonderful restaurants, but after one visit, this delightful restaurant has become our favorite. We met "foodie" friends for dinner. We each had the special for the night with a perfectly matched wine suggested by the waiter. Make reservations!

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: Best Italian food anywhere! Phenomenal service, great bar....too good to miss, homemade pasta, great shrimp scampi and the seafood fra Diablo cannot be beat, why travel to the north end when there is Rosetti's in downtown Lynn. Don't miss out.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: Went for a work team building dinner.  Everything was wonderful. Food and service was great. Lots of yummy appetizers.
